definitions.text: extensive tract of level open land
examples: they emerged from the woods onto a vast open plain
he longed for the fields of his youth

definitions.text: express complaints, discontent, displeasure, or unhappiness
examples: She has a lot to kick about

definitions.text: clearly revealed to the mind or the senses or judgment
examples: the effects of the drought are apparent to anyone who sees the parched fields
it is plain that he is no reactionary

definitions.text: free from any effort to soften to disguise
examples: the unvarnished candor of old people and children
functional architecture featuring stark unornamented concrete

definitions.text: lacking in physical beauty or proportion
examples: several of the buildings were downright homely
a plain girl with a freckled face

definitions.text: unmistakably (`plain' is often used informally for `plainly')
examples: she was in bed and evidently in great pain
he was manifestly too important to leave off the guest list
she has apparently been living here for some time
I thought he owned the property, but apparently not
